CCMH IT Asset Management System

Data Models¶

User¶

User data model.

This module contains functions, variables, and classes related to user data persistance and relationships.

app.users.user.departments_users¶

Table

Stores the relationship between users and departments.

app.users.user.roles_users¶

Table

Stores the relationship between users and roles.

app.users.user.user_datastore¶

SQLAlchemyUserDatastore

The user datastore object. This object is used to access convenience functions related to querying user data.

class app.users.user.User(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model, flask_security.core.UserMixin

User data database model.

The user model provides data about users and their roles in the application.

id¶

int

Unique identifier for the user that is used internally.

email¶

string

The user’s email address.

password¶

string

A salted hash of the user’s password.

active¶

boolean

The active/deactive state of a user. Deactive users can not log in, but thier information is not destroyed.

confirmed_at¶

datetime

The date and time the user was created.

first_name¶

string

The first name of the user.

last_name¶

string

The last name of the user.

roles¶

list of Role

A list of roles the user has assigned to them.

departments¶

list of Departments

A list of the departments the user is assocated with.

full_name[source]¶

string

The user’s full name in form ‘First Last’.

static list()[source]¶
Returns:List containing objects for all users in the database.
verify_password(password)[source]¶
Parameters:password (string) – The user’s plaintext password.
Returns:True if password is valid. False otherwise.

Role¶

class app.roles.role.Role(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: flask_sqlalchemy.Model, flask_security.core.RoleMixin

The user role data model.

User roles are defined when the application is initialized. To add additional roles, insert them into the database from the app.create_app() function using the user_datastore.create_role() function.

description¶

Short description of the role.

id¶

Generated id for the role.

name¶

The name of the role. This attribute is used when checking for user roles using the @role_required decorator.
